intro: Daucalis mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritania carrot, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Daucalis mauritanica is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
